perturbation.original_text:
THIS SECOND AMENDMENT TO CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT (this "Amendment") is
made and entered into, effective for all purposes and in all respects as of
the 23rd day of February, 1998, by and between PC QUOTE, INC., with its
principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois
60605 ("PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc., with its principal place of business at
33 West 17th Street, New York, New York 10011 ("ABW").
perturbation.changed_text:
THIS SECOND AMENDMENT TO CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT (this "Modification") is
made and entered into, effective for all purposes and in all respects as of
the 23rd day of February, 1998, by and between PC QUOTE, INC., with its
principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois
60605 ("PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc., with its principal place of business at
33 West 17th Street, New York, New York 10011 ("ABW").
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Amendment" to "Modification" creates confusion as to whether this document is an amendment or a new type of modification, making reference throughout the rest of the document to the 'Amendment' unclear.

perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Understanding dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Agreement" to "Understanding" in this clause introduces ambiguity. Is the original contract an agreement or an understanding? This could affect the enforceability of specific clauses later on.

perturbation.original_text:
Except as modified hereby, the Agreement and its terms and
provisions are hereby ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all
respects.
perturbation.changed_text:
Except as modified hereby, the Contract and its terms and
provisions are hereby ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all
respects.
perturbation.explanation: The contract uses both "Agreement" (as defined previously) and "Contract" interchangeably but doesn't define "Contract." This leaves uncertainty as to which document (if any) is being ratified.
